result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony R. Sittig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions for concurrent counts 1, 2 and 4 (there is a felony DPA on count 3):

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming or counsel as directed by the agent.

Court orders 1 set of court costs for this case.  That will be paid from the bond that is posted in this case.  Defendant will only still need to pay costs of supervision.

Defendant to submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

6 days credit stipulated to in the event of revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Dodge as reception center.  Defendant to be eligible for all programming options.  This sentence is consecutive to the Grant County sentence defendant is presently serving.  Counsel have stipulated to 0 days credit in this case as all credit was used in the Grant County matter.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling and/or programming directed by the agent. 

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig in court, in custody, with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA - State asks for 6 mo jail sentence, consecutive to what def is presently sitting, on the misdemeanors in this case and 18 mo prison and 2 years extended supervision on the felony which was subject to DPA; asks that the felony sentence run concurrent with the misdemeanors' sentence.  Atty. Bartelt addreses the Court.  Def and family member address the Court.

Count 3 - DPA revoked.  Sentence:  42 mo incarceration in prison system with 18 mo initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Def to be eligible for both programming options.  Costs.  Consecutive to Grant County case.  Conditions of ES to be at discretion of the agent.

Counts 1, 2, and 4 - sentence:  6 mo on each count, all concurrent with each other and concurrent with sentence on count 3.

Credit:  was given on Grant County case.

Any cash bonds in place to be converted to signature bond - no contact with Ms. B deleted.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  15CF110, 16CF37, 15CF57, 16CF36, 15CF57, 15CF109, 15CF98, and 15CF100.  Def waives prelim rights in all matters except for 15CF57 as that is a sentencing after rev case and needs to be set for a hearing.  Court accepts prelim waiver and conducts waiver colloquy.  State files informations.  Formal readings waived in each case.  Court states the charges.  Def pleads not guilty to all felonies and also to the misdemeanors in these cases.  DA asks for sentencing date in 15CF57 to address sentencing after rev and sentencing after revocation of DPA; asks for this to be yet in May; doesn't think other cases will be ready for dispo at that time.  Court sets 15CF57 for 2:30 5/13.  All other matters set for 6/22 at 10 - status.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Associated with Charge #2
Status conference on May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

This is a post-judgment matter - Count 3 subject to DPA revocation.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 01-13-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Anthony R. Sittig.  Several cases called together.  In newest matters, 15CF109 and 15CF110, complaint filed today and Atty. McDougal has not had an opportunity to review with her client; requests setover to status or adjourned initial in all matters.  So ordered.  Def presently in custody with a probation hold.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference at 12-16-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Anthony R. Sittig.  3 cases called together:
15CF100/initial, 15CF98/adjourned initial,, and 15CF57/motion hearing.

15CF57 - State is motioning to to revoke diversion agreement.  Atty. M asks for setover.
15CF98 - formal reading waived.  Charges stated, max. penalties stated, rights states.  Prelim not yet requested; just status for time being.
15CF100 - Atty. M states she wasn't aware this case was coming; hasn't had opportunity to review with her client.  Initial adj.

12/16 at 1:30 for adjourned initial in 15CF100, status in both 15CF98 and 15CF57.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony R. Sittig in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  Prelim waived.  Colloquy conducted.  State offers amendment of count 1 to misdemeanor possession.  Def pleads no contest to count 1 as amended and to counts 2, 3, and 4 as charged.  Finding of guilty.  Jt recommendation calls for DPA on the felony charge/count 3 and probation with costs for counts 1, 2, and 4.  Sentence:  Court adopts 4 yr div. agreement for count 3.  On remaining counts, Court orders 2 years probation with conditions of costs; attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming required by agent.  Credit in the event of revocation:  6 days.  Defense requests 1 set of court costs.  So ordered.
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-21-2015 03:30 pm

DA requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant but stays it until next date - Oct. 21 at  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
